meanings.definition: Shriver - a person who shrives or confesses sins
meanings.sent1: The shrivers at the church were always ready to listen and offer forgiveness.
meanings.sent2: The village had a dedicated group of shrivers who helped people seek redemption.
meanings.sent3: The shrivers in the confessional booth had a long line of penitents waiting for their turn.
meanings.sent4: The shrivers' compassionate ears welcomed all confessions, no matter how heavy the burden.
meanings.sent5: The shrivers' kind hearts embraced each sinner with understanding and grace.

meanings.definition: Shriver - to hear the confession of and give absolution to
meanings.sent1: The priest would shriver the parishioners during the weekly confessions.
meanings.sent2: It is important for a shriver to offer comfort and guidance to those seeking forgiveness.
meanings.sent3: The shriver patiently listened to the long list of sins without judgment.
meanings.sent4: Her words had the power to shriver away the guilt and bring peace to troubled souls.
meanings.sent5: The act of shrivering allowed the penitent to unburden their soul and start anew.

meanings.definition: Shriver - to impose penance on and absolve
meanings.sent1: The priest would shriver a penance of prayers and good deeds to atone for the sins.
meanings.sent2: The shriver's role was not only to forgive but also to guide the sinner towards repentance.
meanings.sent3: After shrivering the wrongdoer, the priest offered words of encouragement for a fresh start.
meanings.sent4: The shriver's words had the power to cleanse the soul and lift the weight of guilt.
meanings.sent5: The act of shrivering was a sacred ritual that brought peace and renewal to the troubled heart.
